description: To carry out tree surgery including a crown reduction by 2.5m to One Oak T2 on TPO 35
decision_conditions: The Oak is situated within the rear garden of 3 Buttsmead it is a significant and prominent landscape feature to those living in, and visiting, Buttsmead, The Gravel Pits and The Copse Wood Estate with a high amenity value and it significantly contributes to local biodiversity and Area of Special Local Character (Copsewood Estate) providing a gradual transition of mature tree cover between the dwellings in the copse wood estate and the nearby Ruislip woods National Nature Reserve (NNR). The benefit in amenity and biodiversity afforded by the tree is both present and future because it has the potential for a long life.

There currently appears to be no joined up thinking for the management of this Oak tree having also received a recent application for greater works due to alleged damage to the property (17163/TRE/2022/91) and no reference to any damage on this application.
